title: Mount Beddie
text: Mount Beddie () is a rounded, snow-covered <a href="mountain">mountain</a> rising to 435 m on <a href="Hulot%20Peninsula">Hulot Peninsula</a> in the southwest end of <a href="Brabant%20Island">Brabant Island</a>, <a href="Palmer%20Archipelago">Palmer Archipelago</a>. The mountain was charted and named by the <a href="French%20Antarctic%20Expedition">French Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1903–05, led by <a href="Jean-Baptiste%20Charcot">Jean-Baptiste Charcot</a>.
